meanings.definition: To perform better than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The new model of the car will outperform the old one.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to outperform his competitors in the race.
meanings.sent3: The student's robot project managed to outperform even the teacher's expectations.
meanings.sent4: The young musician's talent outperformed his years, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent5: The solar panels outperform traditional energy sources in terms of efficiency.

meanings.definition: To surpass in performance or achievement.
meanings.sent1: The company aims to outperform its competitors in the market.
meanings.sent2: With dedication and hard work, she was able to outperform her own expectations.
meanings.sent3: The team's creativity and innovation helped them outperform the competition.
meanings.sent4: The student's artwork outperformed all the other entries in the contest.
meanings.sent5: The new software update will outperform the previous version in speed and reliability.
